keyword: how many calories in filet mignon steak
title: How Many Calories in Filet Mignon Steak?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in filet mignon steak for a standard 6 oz serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition details with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in Filet Mignon Steak?
assumptions: 6 oz (170 g) cooked weight, broiled, lean only, trimmed to 0" fat, choice grade, no added oil, butter, or seasoning.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, cooking method, added fats, and portion size. Check labels or use a food scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A 6-oz broiled filet mignon steak provides ~350 kcal and ~52 g protein.

basis.label: per 1 6-oz (170 g) broiled filet mignon steak

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a 6 oz filet mignon steak?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a lean, broiled 6 oz serving.

faqs.q: What's the protein in filet mignon steak?
faqs.a: About 52 g protein per 6 oz steak, making it a high-protein option.
No carbs, fiber, or sugarsâ€”it's nearly all protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in filet mignon?
faqs.a: Broiling keeps it lean; frying or adding fats can add 40+ kcal per tsp of oil or butter.

faqs.q: Is filet mignon lower in fat than other steaks?
faqs.a: Yes, it's one of the leanest cuts at ~14 g fat per 6 oz vs. higher in ribeye or T-bone.
